Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
heads-up \heads-up\ adj. maintaining presence of mind; alert and attentive; able to recognize and take quick advantage of opportunities; resourceful; as, he played good heads-up baseball.
Syn: wide-awake. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: heads-up \heads-up\ n. [From its use as an interjection to warn of impending danger.] a warning to be prepared for an imminent event. [PJC]
heads-up adj : fully alert and watchful; "played heads-up ball" [syn: {wide-awake}]
